newsitem.title: USA: Stage Stores unit to tender for notes. [corrected 21:35 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Stage Stores unit to tender for notes. [corrected 21:35 gmt]

text.p: Thursday that its unit, Specialty Retailers Inc, has commenced a tender offer and consent solicitation for its outstanding 10 percent senior notes due 2000 and its 11 percent series B senior subordinated notes due 2003 (corrects type of debt security to indicate senior subordinated note) and 11 percent series D senior subordinated notes due 2003.

In a written statement, Stage Stores said Specialty Retailers plans to issue up to $300 million in new debt securities and enter into a new $200 million bank facility in conjuction with the tender offers.
Market sources said the company is likely to issue $200 million in new senior notes and $100 million in new senior subordinated notes. Credit Suisse First Boston will underwrite the deal, they said.
Calls to the company were not returned.
The company will pay a tender premium for the outstanding senior notes equal to a yield to first call of 75 basis points over comparable Treasuries.
The company will pay a tender premium for the outstanding senior subordinated notes equal to a yield to first call of 100 basis points over comparable Treasuries.
The tender offers will expire on June 5, 1997.
Stage Stores operates 327 department stores in 20 states across the central U.S.
